tit.cmt: (米原市)が抜けていたので、加筆しました。

sen.j: 筑摩神社（ちくまじんじゃ）は滋賀県米原市にある神社。
sen.e: Chikuma-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
Chikuma-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
Chikuma-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 祭神は御食津神・ウカノミタマ・大年神で、いずれも食物に関係のある神である。
sen.e: The enshrined deities are Miketsukami, Ukano-mitama and Otoshi no kami, and they are all gods related to food.
The enshrined deities are Miketsukami, Uka no mitama and Otoshi no kami, and they are all gods related to food.
The enshrined deities are Miketsukami, Uka no mitama and Otoshi no kami, and they are all gods related to food.
History
History
History

sen.j: 孝安天皇28年に創建されたとされているが、延喜式神名帳の記載はない。
sen.e: It is said to have been founded in the year of Emperor Koan 28, but it is not listed in Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines).
sen.cmt: 孝安天皇２８年の西暦がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: It is said to have been founded in B.C. 365, but it is not listed in Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines).
sen.cmt: 孝安天皇28年→紀元前365年the year of Emperor Koan 28 > B.C. 365
sen.e: It is said to have been founded in B.C. 365, but it is not listed in Engishiki Jinmyocho (a list of shrines).

sen.j: 社伝によれば、継体天皇が越前から上京する際に、当社のそばに行宮を設け、社殿を再建して神域を定めたとされている。
sen.e: The shrine tradition says that Emperor Keitai determined the holy precincts of the shrine by building Angu (temporary lodging to accommodate an Imperial visit) beside the shrine and rebuilding a main building of the shrine when he went to Kyoto from Echizen (present Fukui Prefecture).

The shrine tradition says that Emperor Keitai determined the holy precincts of the shrine by building Angu (temporary lodging to accommodate an Imperial visit) beside the shrine and rebuilding a main building of the shrine when he went to Kyoto from Echizen (present Fukui Prefecture).

The shrine tradition says that Emperor Keitai determined the holy precincts of the shrine by building Angu (temporary lodging to accommodate an Imperial visit) beside the shrine and rebuilding a main building of the shrine when he went to Kyoto from Echizen (present Fukui Prefecture).

sen.j: 鎮座地の筑摩は桓武天皇の時代に内裏大膳職の御厨が置かれた地で、延久2年（1070年）に御厨が廃されるまで御厨の鎮守とされた。
sen.e: Chikuma, where the shrine is located, used to be the manor of Dairi Daizen-shiki (the Office of the Palace Table of the Court) in the year of Emperor Kanmu and it was considered a guardian of the manor until it was abolished in 1070.

Chikuma, where the shrine is located, used to be the manor of Dairi Daizen-shiki (the Office of the Palace Table of the Court) in the year of Emperor Kanmu and it had been considered a guardian of the manor until it was abolished in 1070.
sen.cmt: it was considered a guardian of the manor until it was abolished in 1070 > it had been considered a guardian of the manor until it was abolished in 1070
sen.e: Chikuma, where the shrine is located, used to be the manor of Dairi Daizen-shiki (the Office of the Palace Table of the Court) in the year of Emperor Kanmu and it had been considered a guardian of the manor until it was abolished in 1070.

sen.j: 後鳥羽天皇や源頼朝からも神領が寄進され、寛元3年には最高位の正一位の神階が授けられた。
sen.e: Estates were also donated by the retired Emperor Gotoba and MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, and the rank of Shoichi (Senior First Rank) was conferred on the deities of the shrine in 1245.
Estates were also donated by the retired Emperor Gotoba and MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, and the rank of Shoichi (Senior First Rank) was conferred on the deities of the shrine in 1245.
Estates were also donated by the retired Emperor Gotoba and MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, and the rank of Shoichi (Senior First Rank) was conferred on the deities of the shrine in 1245.

sen.j: 江戸時代には彦根藩主井伊氏の崇敬を受けた。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, it was revered by the Ii clan, the lord of the Hikone Domain.
In the Edo period, it was revered by the Ii clan, the lord of the Hikone Domain.
sen.cmt: the Edo Period > the Edo period
sen.e: In the Edo period, it was revered by the Ii clan, the lord of the Hikone Domain.
Rites and festivals
Rites and Festivals
sen.cmt: 先頭大文字にしました。
sen.e: Rites and Festivals

sen.j: 5月3日の春の大祭では、御旅所から神社までの約1kmを総勢200人がねり歩く。
sen.e: In the major festival of May 3, a total of 200 people parade about one kilometer from Otabisho (a temporary accommodation for the portable shrine) to the shrine.
In the major spring festival of May 3, a total of 200 people parade about one kilometer from Otabisho (a temporary accommodation for the portable shrine) to the shrine.
sen.cmt: the major festival > the major spring festival
sen.e: In the major spring festival of May 3, a total of 200 people parade about one kilometer from Otabisho (a temporary accommodation for the portable shrine) to the shrine.

sen.j: その行列の中に狩衣姿の数え年8歳前後の少女8人が鍋を被って加わることから「鍋冠祭（なべかぶりまつり）」とも呼ばれ、日本三大奇祭の一つとされることがある。
sen.e: In the parade are eight girls of around eight years of age wearing Kariginu (informal clothes for court nobles) and pots on their heads, so the festival is called 'the Nabekaburi matsuri' (the Pot-wearing Festival) and is often considered one of the three major strange festivals of Japan.
sen.cmt: 「数え年」は訳しておりません。
sen.e: In the parade are eight girls of around eight years of age wearing Kariginu (informal clothes for court nobles) and pots on their heads, so the festival is called 'the Nabekaburi matsuri' (the Pot-wearing Festival) and is often considered one of the three major strange festivals of Japan.

In the parade are eight girls of around eight years of age wearing Kariginu (informal clothes for court nobles) and pots on their heads, so the festival is called 'the Nabekaburi matsuri' (the Pot-wearing Festival) and is often considered one of the three major strange festivals of Japan.

sen.j: 当社の祭神が全て食物に関係のある神であることから、このような祭が生まれたと考えられている。
sen.e: The festival is thought to have started because the enshrined deities of this shrine are all related to food.
The festival is thought to have started because the enshrined deities of this shrine are all related to food.
The festival is thought to have started because the enshrined deities of this shrine are all related to food.

sen.j: 鍋冠祭は米原市の無形民俗文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: The Nabekaburi matsuri is designated as an intangible asset of folk culture by Maibara City.
The Nabekaburi matsuri is designated as an intangible asset of folk culture by Maibara City.
The Nabekaburi matsuri is designated as an intangible asset of folk culture by Maibara City.
